name: restamp
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put a mark on an object again, either by printing on it or pushing into it with a small tool: The bureaucrats issue, stamp, restamp, and verify the vehicle permits. They concealed the original manufacturer's label and restamped it with their own.
to give something or someone a particular quality again: They were looking for a strong leader who would restamp central government's authority on the regions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe serial number on the engine can be sanded off and restamped.The bike was hard to sell like that, so my boss had it restamped.Each coin that was not perfect was rejected, sent back for re-melting, and re-stamped. Ministers expect him to re-stamp his authority on the Cabinet by shaking up his Ministerial team.She has come back to restamp her personality on the game.
